Key Match Events: Sanchez (34') scored the first goal, Diaz (52') added another, Duran (82') scored, and Sinisterra (90+3') scored the last goal for Colombia, while Cordoba (37') and Mojica (78') scored for Chile. Tapia (65') and Pulgar (77') also scored for Chile.
Pre-Game Insights: Colombia will look to recover from a shock defeat last week when they host bottom-placed Chile in CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying on Tuesday.
Colombia remain in second, though, as Uruguay also lost last week, and the gap to Argentina at the top is only three points.
Chile are a much different team now though, as yet another defeat on Thursday saw them fall into last position in the CONMEBOL standings.
Colombia World Cup Qualifying - South America form: D, W, W, D, W, L
Chile World Cup Qualifying - South America form: L, D, L, L, L, L
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia will be glad of the home comforts in Barranquilla and should bounce back to maintain their spot in the top two.
Slipping to the foot of the standings will demoralise Chile even more after what was already a gut-wrenching defeat late on against Brazil.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia took 10 points from a possible 12 in Barranquilla in this campaign.
Chile have proven difficult opponents over the years, winning only once at home to their upcoming opponents since 2001.
Chile are staring down the barrel at a fifth straight qualifying defeat.
Others: Colombia possible starting lineup: Vargas; S. Arias, Mina, Lucumi, Borja; Uribe, Lerma, Rios; James, Duran, Diaz
Chile possible starting lineup: Cortes; Loyola, Kuscevic, Maripan, Galdames; Valdes, Pavez, Echeverria; Osorio, Davila, Vargas
